prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing thank-you greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

ðŸŽ¨ CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clichÃ© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "Thank you for attending AI For Good June 2025, thank you for helping prosper thought. include a nice quote in left interior. front Cover include John Gilbert clearly "
Style: âœ¨ Smart Style
Tone: ðŸŒŸ Inspirational - motivating and uplifting
To: John Gilbert

Message: "Thank you for being a vital part of the conversation. Your presence and unique perspective helped plant the seeds for a brighter, more thoughtful future. Continue to let your curiosity lead the way and inspire positive change wherever you go."



CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front â†’ interior â†’ back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the motivating and uplifting tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way








Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "thank-you" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). TEXT STYLE: Write the greeting text in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that matches the elegant style used inside the card - legible, flowing, and graceful with natural character and warmth. Create charming cartoon-style or stylized illustrated figures if people are needed for the theme. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in a warm, painterly watercolor and ink illustration style. The front cover features a beautiful, flourishing tree, its branches heavy with vibrant, abstract leaves that blend soft hues of teal, gold, and warm sienna, symbolizing the growth of new ideas. Delicate, hand-drawn ink lines define the tree and leaves, giving it an organic, personal touch. At the base of the tree, subtle, glowing orbs of light are nestled amongst the roots, representing the seeds of thought. The name "John Gilbert" is integrated artfully into the design, written in a graceful, flowing ink script that feels both personal and distinguished. The overall effect is one of natural beauty and thoughtful appreciation, evoking a sense of calm, creativity, and heartfelt gratitude.

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a thank-you card with motivating and uplifting tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in a warm, painterly watercolor and ink illustration style. The front cover features a beautiful, flourishing tree, its branches heavy with vibrant, abstract leaves that blend soft hues of teal, gold, and warm sienna, symbolizing the growth of new ideas. Delicate, hand-drawn ink lines define the tree and leaves, giving it an organic, personal touch. At the base of the tree, subtle, glowing orbs of light are nestled amongst the roots, representing the seeds of thought. The name "John Gilbert" is integrated artfully into the design, written in a graceful, flowing ink script that feels both personal and distinguished. The overall effect is one of natural beauty and thoughtful appreciation, evoking a sense of calm, creativity, and heartfelt gratitude.

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "Thank you for being a vital part of the conversation. Your presence and unique perspective helped plant the seeds for a brighter, more thoughtful future. Continue to let your curiosity lead the way and inspire positive change wherever you go." positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. HANDWRITING STYLE: Write the message in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that feels elegant and personal. The handwriting should be legible, flowing, and have natural character - not overly perfect but graceful and warm. Use a nice pen-style appearance with natural ink flow and slight variations in line weight. Think of sophisticated calligraphy that's still approachable and easy to read. Make the handwriting feel genuine and heartfelt. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the handwritten message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clichÃ© designs and create something genuinely special! Use the elegant cursive handwriting style described above. Style: in a warm, painterly watercolor and ink illustration style. The front cover features a beautiful, flourishing tree, its branches heavy with vibrant, abstract leaves that blend soft hues of teal, gold, and warm sienna, symbolizing the growth of new ideas. Delicate, hand-drawn ink lines define the tree and leaves, giving it an organic, personal touch. At the base of the tree, subtle, glowing orbs of light are nestled amongst the roots, representing the seeds of thought. The name "John Gilbert" is integrated artfully into the design, written in a graceful, flowing ink script that feels both personal and distinguished. The overall effect is one of natural beauty and thoughtful appreciation, evoking a sense of calm, creativity, and heartfelt gratitude.

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. IMPORTANT: Leave the bottom-right corner area (approximately 1 inch square) completely clear and undecorated - this space is reserved for a QR code. Focus decorative elements toward the center and left side of the design. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in a warm, painterly watercolor and ink illustration style. The front cover features a beautiful, flourishing tree, its branches heavy with vibrant, abstract leaves that blend soft hues of teal, gold, and warm sienna, symbolizing the growth of new ideas. Delicate, hand-drawn ink lines define the tree and leaves, giving it an organic, personal touch. At the base of the tree, subtle, glowing orbs of light are nestled amongst the roots, representing the seeds of thought. The name "John Gilbert" is integrated artfully into the design, written in a graceful, flowing ink script that feels both personal and distinguished. The overall effect is one of natural beauty and thoughtful appreciation, evoking a sense of calm, creativity, and heartfelt gratitude.

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.frontCover: Front cover of a greeting card with a dark navy blue, textured background. At the top, in elegant, flowing, off-white cursive script, is the text "Thank you for helping prosper thought." Below the text, a central, large, intricately designed gear is depicted in shades of silver and gold. This central gear has a floral-like pattern within it, also in gold and silver. Branching out from the top and sides of this central gear are numerous smaller gears, varying in size and color (gold and silver), connected by delicate, thin lines that resemble stylized branches or circuitry. The overall aesthetic is sophisticated and slightly industrial-artistic, with a feeling of intricate connectivity and progress. At the bottom center of the card, there is a decorative, metallic-effect plaque or banner with a light grey border and a subtle yellow-gold fill, containing the name "JOHN GILBERT" in a clear, sans-serif font, also in off-white or light grey. The entire image has a subtle, almost painterly texture.
generatedPrompts.backCover: Back cover design for a greeting card with a deep, textured navy blue background. In the upper-left quadrant, a single, stylized, bright orange cogwheel is centered, emitting a soft, warm glow. A delicate, wispy white line, resembling chalk or a light brushstroke, curves gracefully from the top edge of the card down towards the cogwheel, appearing to have just connected or originated from it. The overall style is minimalist and symbolic, conveying a sense of focused energy or a singular idea. The composition is clean and uncluttered, leaving ample negative space. There is no text or QR code visible on this back cover. The artistic style suggests a subtle texture, similar to fine paper or a soft pastel drawing, creating a sophisticated and understated finish that brings a quiet, conceptual closure to the card's visual narrative.
generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a greeting card with a dark navy blue background, featuring a complex, interconnected network of gears and pipes in a steampunk-inspired, industrial aesthetic. The gears are primarily in shades of brass and a darker, muted blue-grey, with intricate teeth and spokes. They are arranged in an overlapping, layered pattern, creating a sense of depth. Flowing through and around the gears are stylized pipes, rendered in a warm, glowing amber-orange color, emitting a soft light that illuminates the surrounding metallic surfaces. These pipes form a dynamic, winding pathway across the page. Centered within this mechanical landscape, the quote "The best way to predict the future is to invent it." is displayed in a flowing, elegant, golden-yellow cursive font, reminiscent of a quill pen on parchment. The text is positioned to avoid the top and bottom 10% edges. The overall style is a flat 2D illustration with subtle texturing and a focus on detailed linework, evoking a sense of innovation, progress, and sophisticated craftsmanship. The composition is balanced, with the mechanical elements framing the central quote.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior: Right interior page of a greeting card designed for message space with a framed, ornate border. The border is composed of intricate, interlocking gears and swirling filigree in muted blues and antique gold. The gears are depicted in a flat, 2D illustration style with subtle shading to give them a sense of depth. The filigree elements are rendered with delicate, hand-drawn ink lines that mimic the texture of antique engravings. The background within the frame is a soft, textured pale blue watercolor wash. The text, "Thank you for being a vital part of the conversation. Your presence and unique perspective helped plant the seeds for a brighter, more thoughtful future. Continue to let your curiosity lead the way and inspire positive change wherever you go.", is presented in a beautiful, flowing cursive script in a dark, rich ink. The handwriting is elegant and legible, with natural variations in line weight, conveying a personal and sophisticated touch. The overall aesthetic is a blend of vintage industrial and artistic sophistication, creating a visually engaging and inspiring space for the handwritten message. The style is a warm, painterly watercolor and ink illustration, with a color palette dominated by muted blues, antique gold, and a pale, textured background.
